channel.title: Puppet Strings and Observer interactions
channel.description:
I know that if The Observer watches the target that The Possessor sends a Puppet Strings target to attack, they'll see the person being manipulated by Puppet Strings as the visitor. (That's part of the point of Puppet Strings, after all.)
But what happens if the Observer watches the person The Possessor used Puppet Strings to control? Let's say that that person also performed a normal visit (eg. they're a Sheriff investigating someone.) Does the Observer see them making two visits?

item.title: Puppet Strings and Observer interactions
item.dc:creator: Aquillion
item.description:
Yeah, that was my assumption, but I’m curious if anyone knows for certain.

(And if he watches a CW who uses Tornado and is also Puppet Strings’ed, does he see three visits?)

This is an extremely important question, because remember, he’s also going to see the Possessor’s visit, so if a suspicious extra visit indicates Puppet Strings, he could use this to find the Possessor in a few cases.

Read full topic

item.title: Puppet Strings and Observer interactions
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
I would assume that he would see both visits. This is much like if the Cult Leader is seen erraticating.

Read full topic
